Detailed Description

A mesh set of either triangle fans, triangle strips, lines or line strips.

Each set contains a list of inputs and indices of the input.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

FCDGeometryPolygonsSpecial::FCDGeometryPolygonsSpecial (  FCDocument *  document,
FCDGeometryMesh *  parent,
PrimitiveType  _type
) 
 

Constructor: do not use directly.

Instead, use the FCDGeometryMesh::AddPolygons function to create new polygon sets.

Parameters:
document The COLLADA document which owns this polygon set.
parent The geometric mesh which contains this polygon set.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void FCDGeometryPolygonsSpecial::AddFace (  uint32  degree  )  [virtual]
 

Creates a new face.

Enough indices to fill the face will be added to the primitive set inputs: you will want to overwrite those, as they will all be set to zero.

Parameters:
degree Unused as the primitive type will determine the number of vertices.

Reimplemented from FCDGeometryPolygons.

Retrieves the number of faces within the set.

virtual size_t FCDGeometryPolygonsSpecial::GetFaceVertexCount (  size_t  index  )  const [virtual]
 

Retrieves the number of face-vertex pairs for a given face.

This value includes face-vertex pairs that create the primitive and its holes.

Parameters:
index A face index.
Returns:
The number of face-vertex pairs for a given face.

Reimplemented from FCDGeometryPolygons.

virtual size_t FCDGeometryPolygonsSpecial::GetFaceVertexOffset (  size_t  index  )  const [virtual]
 

Retrieves the number of face-vertex pairs which appear before a given face within the primitive set.

This value is useful when doing per-vertex mesh operations within the primitive set.

Parameters:
index The index of the face.
Returns:
The number of face-vertex pairs before the given face, within the primitive set.

Reimplemented from FCDGeometryPolygons.

const UInt32List& FCDGeometryPolygonsSpecial::GetNumberOfVerticesPerList (   )  const [inline]
 

Retrieves the number of indices to use for each primitive.

This is useful if the Collada file specifies multiple

elements, which get all bundled together in the index list.

Returns:
The list of number of indices to use for each primitive.

virtual PrimitiveType FCDGeometryPolygonsSpecial::GetType (   )  const [inline, virtual]
 

Retrieves the type of primitives described in this geometry (lines, triangle strips, etc).

Reimplemented from FCDGeometryPolygons.

virtual bool FCDGeometryPolygonsSpecial::LoadFromXML (  xmlNode *  polygonNode  )  [virtual]
 

[INTERNAL] Reads in the polygon set element from a given COLLADA XML tree node.

COLLADA has multiple polygon set elements. The most common ones are <triangles> and <polylist>.

Parameters:
polygonNode The COLLADA XML tree node.
Returns:
The status of the import. If the status is 'false', it may be dangerous to extract information from the polygon set.

Reimplemented from FCDGeometryPolygons.

virtual void FCDGeometryPolygonsSpecial::RemoveFace (  size_t  index  )  [virtual]
 

Removes a face.

Parameters:
index The index of the face to remove. All the indices associated with this face and all the following ones will also be removed.

Reimplemented from FCDGeometryPolygons.

virtual void FCDGeometryPolygonsSpecial::Triangulate (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Triangulates the primitive set.

Not useful for the kinds of primives processed in this class

virtual xmlNode* FCDGeometryPolygonsSpecial::WriteToXML (  xmlNode *  parentNode  )  const [virtual]
 

[INTERNAL] Writes out the correct polygon set element to the given COLLADA XML tree node.

COLLADA has multiple polygon set elements. The most common ones are <triangles> and <polylist>.

Parameters:
parentNode The COLLADA XML parent node in which to insert the geometric mesh.
Returns:
The created XML tree node.

Reimplemented from FCDGeometryPolygons.
